data.title: Woburn Public Library
data.text:
Woburn Public Library Book Clubs are free and open to anyone interested in joining.

Novel Ideas: Fiction Book Club for Adults

Welcome to Book Club. If this is your first time here, please consider joining us for great books and spirited discussions each month from September to June. We plan to continue with a hybrid format in the fall. Unless recommendations change again, there will be no need to sign up for the in person discussion. Everyone may participate online via Zoom.

Zoom meeting link will be shared close to the meeting date.

The Book Club meets the second Monday of the month except if it’s a holiday and then we will meet the third Monday. The Book Club is free and open to everyone.

Questions or to be added to the participant directory: contact Hermayne Gordon ([email protected] or 781-933-0148)

2024-2025

September: A Prayer for Owen Meany by John Erving

October: Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil: a Savannah story by John Berendt

November: Mrs. Quinn’s Rise to Fame by Olivia Ford

December: Bel Canto by Ann Patchett

January: The Heaven and Earth Grocery Store by James McBride

February: Those Empty Eyesby Charlie Donlea

March: Trust by Hernan Diaz

April: The Lost Bookshop by Evie Woods

May: Funny Story by Emily Henry

June: The Women by Kristin Hannah

Below is a link to the selections along with meeting dates that you can print and save:

Novel Ideas Book Club Picks September 2024-June 2025

SciFi Fantasy Book Club

Join us for our newest book club! The SciFi Fantasy Book Club will meet on the first Wednesday of each month. Meetings are in person at the library, but virtual attendees are also welcome! Zoom links will be sent in registration confirmation emails.

2024-2025

July: Nettle & Bone by T. Kingfisher

August: The Black God’s Drums by P. Djèlí Clark

September: Akata Witch by Nnedi Okorafor

October: The Kaiju Preservation Society by John Scalzi

November: Bindle Punk Bruja by Desideria Mesa

December: To Be Taught, If Fortunate by Becky Chambers

January: The Empress of Salt and Fortune by Nghi Vo

February: Dawn by Octavia Butler

March: Book of Night by Holly Black

April: Shards of Honor by Lois McMaster Bujold

May: The Very Secret Society of Irregular Witches by Sangu Mandanna

June: Hyperion by Dan Simmons

Woburn Walkabout Book Club

A book club for walkers that love to read and readers that love to walk! Sounds like fun, right? Why don’t you join us. You can register here: Woburn Walkabout 2023

We will walk at a moderate pace around Horn Pond while discussing the current month’s selection:

Anthem by Noah Hawley

Our 2023-2024 Book Club List

September: Dear Committee Members

October: The One Hundred Years of Lenni and Margot

November: How Not To Drown In a Glass of Water

December: All That Is Mine I Carry With Me

January: Hello, Beautiful

February: Remarkably Bright Creatures

March: Natural Beauty

April: Anthem

May: The Woman In the Castello

Iris Book Club – An LGBTQ+ Book Club for Teens

Cookin’ the Books – Cookbook Club

This book club is for those who love to cook and share recipes. You will pick a recipe from a chosen cookbook, prepare it and bring your dish to the meeting to share with others.

The group discusses what they like and dislike about the recipes and the cookbook.

We meet monthly, on the last Wednesday of the month from 7:00 until 8:30.

2024:
